report_title: Motorcycle, Bike and Parts Manufacturing Industry Report
executive_summary: The motorcycle, bike and parts manufacturing industry produces two-wheeled vehicles and parts, including on-highway, off-highway and dual motorcycles, scooters, bicycles and parts. As discretionary purchases, demand plummeted during COVID-19 as disposable income fell. Despite a 0.9% revenue jump in 2024 as the economy recovered, overall revenue contracted at an expected CAGR of 2.2% to $6.7 billion through the current period as manufacturers struggled with ballooning input costs. Larger manufacturers were able to pass on costs aiding in recovering demand and profitability.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Hindered Demand for Bikes and Motorcycles
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers primarily consider motorcycles and bikes discretionary purchases for leisure. The pandemic created economic uncertainty and unprecedented stay-at-home orders, contributing to sharp revenue and profit declines in 2020. For example, leading manufacturers, Harley-Davidson and Kawasaki, struggled to generate positive returns in 2020 as consumers shied away from major purchases.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers Have Endured Input Price Volatility
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine have contributed to massive input price volatility through the current period. In particular, spiking crude oil prices have contributed to near-ubiquitous price increases through the supply chain. Large, premium brands, like Harley-Davidson, were able to leverage brand reputations to pass costs onto buyers. In contrast, small manufacturers and more generic bike and parts manufacturers struggled to pass costs onto buyers, contributing to spiking purchase costs and limiting profit for these manufacturers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Climbing Interest Rates Cut Into the Industry's Post-Pandemic Recovery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Climbing interest rates have contributed to weak consumer confidence and sentiment. Poor economic conditions have encouraged consumers to save more, hindering motorcycle and bike sales. Higher interest rates have also made vehicle loans more costly, preventing consumers from purchasing expensive motorcycles. These economic trends have especially prevented lower-income buyers from purchasing new motorcycles.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Unfavorable Trade Conditions Contribute to Climbing Import Penetration
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Tariffs on steel and other goods have hindered supply chain globalization for domestic manufacturers. The dollar's appreciation has also made imports more attractive for domestic buyers, increasing foreign pressure across lower-cost and high-end manufacturing niches. Foreign manufacturers have leveraged lower costs to gain market share.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Improving Economic Conditions Will Support Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers will spend more freely on leisure goods as the economy recovers from the pandemic and rampant inflation. Consumers will have more money to spend on new bikes and motorcycles alongside replacement parts. Consumers will also travel more, leading to greater demand for bikes, scooters and motorcycles from rental shops. The Federal Reserve is also expected to lower interest rates through the outlook period, reducing borrowing costs and making it easier for consumers to finance large discretionary purchases.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Manufacturers Will Need to Adapt to Changing Demographics
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In general, older consumers have more free time and disposable income, enabling motorcycle and bike purchases. Baby Boomers have historically represented the largest consumer group for bikes and motorcycles. Many baby boomers are reaching retirement age, which means they spend less money and have less active lifestyles. Manufacturers and downstream retailers will refocus advertising efforts to attract younger customers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Innovations Will Make Motorcycles More Accessible
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Motorcycle manufacturers will continue to improve motorcycle and bike designs alongside internal production processes to attract new and returning customers and cut internal costs. Manufacturers will increasingly offer safety and fuel-efficiency features, like ride-by-wire throttle control, braking systems, advanced rider assistance systems (ARAS) and traction control to appeal to more risk-averse and environmentally-conscious consumers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Favorable Trade Conditions Will Support Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US dollar's depreciation will create new growth opportunities for domestic motorcycle, bike and parts manufacturers by contributing to stronger export markets while shielding manufacturers from imports. Increased demand in emerging Asia-Pacific and Latin American markets will contribute to growing international demand as these buyers seek inexpensive transportation options.

industry_definition: This industry consists of businesses that manufacture motorcycles, mopeds, scooters, bicycles or tricycles. It also includes businesses that manufacture equipment and parts for these vehicles.
key_trends: Poor economic conditions have hindered growth. The pandemic and climbing interest rates have threatened stable growth for motorcycle, bike and parts manufacturers.

Stable economic growth, lower input prices, favorable trade conditions and innovations will drive expansion. Manufacturers will reap more robust returns as conditions improve through the outlook period.
Manufacturers adhere to a wide range of highway safety and environmental regulations. Manufacturers must ensure safe roadway and off-road operation, depending on the model.
Manufacturers benefit from limited public and private support. Tariffs have protected companies from imports, and most producers are members of various trade organizations.
Older consumers drive business. Baby boomers continue to ride motorcycles at a high rate, but as they age, manufacturers must shift their focus to a younger demographic.
On-highway motorcycles represent the largest segment for manufacturers. Scooters and bikes have become more popular as younger consumers look for easy, cost-effective transportation methods.
Easy access to trade partners is paramount to manufacturers. Manufacturers operate most facilities near key trade routes.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This age group generates the largest portion of sales, with consumers between 45 and 54 generating the most motorcycle and bike sales compared with any other age group.
Younger consumers care more about the environment, so more of them choose to use bicycles and scooters to get around.
As consumers hit this age group, they tend to use motorcycles and bicycles less, as mobility becomes a concern for many as they age.

Many of the people in this age group don't have a driver's license yet, so scooters and bicycles offer ways to get around more quickly than walking and provide an easy alternative to public transportation.

products_and_services.product_description: Manufacturers design on-highway motorcycles for use on public roads and highways; these vehicles have a traditional frame.
Off-highway motorcycles consist of motorcycles without step-through frames; manufacturers design these bikes for uses other than highway riding.
Bicycles are nonmotorized, human-powered vehicles with two wheels and pedals.
Dual motorcycles are a hybrid between off- and on-highway motorcycles; consumers primarily use dual motorcycles for recreational activities but can safely operate them on highways at high speeds.
Scooters are differentiated from motorcycles by their step-through frame, so the rider is not straddling any part.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: New motorcycles and bikes are largely discretionary purchases; demand closely correlates with economic conditions and per capita disposable income.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Appreciating US Dollar Increases Appeal of Imports
international_trade_points.trade_description: The US dollar has grown in strength when compared with its closest trading partners in recent years.

international_trade_points.trade_title: China's Metal Production Ensures Their Success
international_trade_points.trade_description: China is a leading producer of metals, enabling it to undercut domestic manufacturers.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Demand From Emerging Markets Throws A Lifeline To Manufacturers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Demand for motorcycles, bikes and parts is higher per capita in many other countries, especially demand for scooters and off-highway motorcycles.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Supply Chain Disruptions And An Appreciating US Dollar Limit The Benefit Of Exports
international_trade_points.trade_description: As demand for transportation waned while stay-at-home orders were in place during COVID-19, disrupted supply chains limited manufacturers' ability to sell their goods abroad.

business_locations.location_description: The West contains many large, affluent cities in warm climates that command a significant portion of demand.
The Great Lakes have historically been the home of motor vehicle production in the United States, namely in Detroit and Cleveland.

The Rocky Mountains are home to many industry establishments, as being in an area with long open roads and beautiful views increases the appeal of products such as on-highway motorcycles and mountain bikes.
The Southeast is home to the greatest percentage of US population, meaning more access to labor and to demand.
This region is a hub of economic activity and diverse populations.
This region is known for its rich history and cultural significance.
This area offers vast lands, mostly agricultural, contributing to transportation needs.
Home to picturesque landscapes and a growing population, enhancing demand for two-wheeled transport.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration enforces regulations that aim to protect drivers and riders.
Facilities are subject to extensive environmental legislation concerning waste management, air emissions, toxic use reduction and environmental cleanup.
Manufacturers follow workplace and safety regulations set by the Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA).

basis_points.basis_description: Brand loyalty keeps competitors behind the most prominent manufacturers.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition from other modes of transport
basis_points.basis_description: Bike and motorcycle manufacturers face stiff competition from automakers and public transportation.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Many of the larger US manufacturers of motorcycles, bikes and parts have explored offshoring their operations.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Manufacturers Take Advantage of Poor Economic Conditions to Consolidate
concentration_points.concentration_description: Larger manufacturers have had an easier time withstanding the negative impact of the pandemic.
Brand recognition has played a large role in this growth.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers have faced major supply chain disruptions following the pandemic.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled Labor Is Vital for Manufacturers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers have increasingly invested in research and development to appeal to more customers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Rising automation is slowly decreasing the need for labor
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Rising automation is slowly decreasing the need for labor, but companies still need manual labor for many aspects of the design and manufacturing process.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low level of new patents and concentration of patents
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic uncertainty drains interest in motorcycles and bikes
volatility_points.volatility_description: While the COVID-19 pandemic gave consumers more free time to explore new interests, the economic downturn detracted from demand for motorcycles and bikes.
Supply chain disruptions also limited domestic motorcycle and bike production.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Safety concerns drive consumers away from motorcycles
volatility_points.volatility_description: Many potential buyers shy away from motorcycle purchases, citing lack of vehicle and especially crash safety.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers also regularly adopt new technology to reduce wage costs and streamline production.

FAQs.question: Was your company affected significantly by import competition from abroad during the height of the COVID-19 pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Increased competition from Asian countries has inhibited industry performance.

FAQs.question: How has your company leveraged new technology to limit declines during the pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Recent technological advancements in the industry have been in the areas of computer-aided design, computer-aided manufacturing and numerically controlled machine tools.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs and meet demand during the pandemic by automating any operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies reducing wage costs through automation long-term were most successful at navigating the pandemic.

FAQs.question: What effect have international travel bans implemented to curtail the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus) had on your ability to import and export products?
FAQs.answer: Quarantining orders and global government-instated travel bans throttled most export distribution channels in 2020.

FAQs.question: Has your company stayed ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards, which began shifting drastically in 2022?
FAQs.answer: Motorcycles are subject to certification by the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) for compliance with applicable emissions and noise standards.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Drops in the price of steel have generally hurt profits for companies within the industry.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Motorcycles and bikes usually fare better in fair weather environments and seasons.

FAQs.question: Was your company able to develop new products despite quarantining measures being put in place in 2020?
FAQs.answer: The success of many companies in this industry depends on their ability to identify, hire, develop, motivate and retain skilled professionals.

FAQs.question: How much of your revenue is derived from export markets?
How have sales to the baby-boomer demographic trended in recent years?
FAQs.answer: The industry is sensitive to population growth and age distribution.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor changes in per capita disposable income?
FAQs.answer: Motorcycles and bikes are considered discretionary purchases.
